content.question: Which of the following best explains the most likely method by which this antitumor drug works?

choices.label: Trabectedin increases the production of cyclin proteins that signal the cancer cells to enter prophase.
Trabectedin interferes with the plasma membrane, causing it to break down and expose the <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> to damage.

Trabectedin interferes with the duplication of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> during interphase and thus prevents cancer cells from passing the <math alttext="G 2 " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></math> checkpoint.
Trabectedin interferes with the regulations of cyclin proteins, causing their levels to increase and creating errors in <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math>.

content.answer: Trabectedin interferes with the duplication of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> during interphase and thus prevents cancer cells from passing the <math alttext="G 2 " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></math> checkpoint.

skill.text: 6.D: Explain the relationship between experimental results and larger biological concepts, processes, or theories.
